style_full_name: Evocative and Memorable Titles (Contemporary Translations: BSB, Majority, WEB)

stories.story_title: Creation Week: God's Grand Opening
stories.summary: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth. Over six days, He ordered creation perfectly, bringing light, sky, land, vegetation, and all living creatures into being. On the seventh day, He rested and sanctified it.

stories.story_title: Eden: Paradise Lost in One Bite
stories.summary: God formed Adam in His own image and placed him in the Garden of Eden. God gave him one command: don't eat from the tree of knowledge. But through the serpent's deception, Adam and Eve disobeyed, were expelled, and faced death and suffering.

stories.story_title: Cain & Abel: First Blood, First Blame
stories.summary: Adam's sons, Cain and Abel, brought offerings to the Lord. God accepted Abel's sacrifice but rejected Cain's. Angry and jealous, Cain killed his brother Abel. God marked Cain and sent him as a fugitive from the ground that had received his brother's blood.

stories.story_title: Patriarchs of Old: The Long View
stories.summary: The early patriarchs—from Adam through Noah—lived for hundreds of years. Enoch walked with God so closely that he was taken to heaven without experiencing death. But corruption and evil spread throughout the human race.

stories.story_title: The Corruption Deepens: Prelude to Flood
stories.summary: The sons of God took human wives, and giants were born. The earth became filled with violence and wickedness. Yet Noah found favor with the Lord and stood righteous in his generation.

stories.story_title: Noah's Ark: Floodgates of Fury and Favor
stories.summary: God commanded Noah to build an ark and bring his family and animals aboard. The waters of judgment flooded the earth and destroyed all living things. God remembered Noah, the waters receded, and He made a covenant, setting the rainbow as a sign.

stories.story_title: Nations Scattered: Table and Confusion
stories.summary: Noah's sons multiplied and their descendants spread across the earth and spoke one language. But when they tried to build a tower reaching to heaven in their pride, God confused their speech and scattered them across the land.

stories.story_title: The Narrowing Begins: Genealogy to Abram
stories.summary: The genealogy descended from Shem through Terah and his son Abram. God's focus narrowed from all the nations of the earth to a single family chosen for covenant and blessing.

stories.story_title: Abram's Call: Stranger Becomes Star-Dust Father
stories.summary: The Lord called Abram to leave his homeland and family, promising to make him a great nation. Abram believed God and journeyed to Canaan, building altars and calling on the name of the Lord.

stories.story_title: Egypt and Lot: First Tests of Faith
stories.summary: A famine drove Abram to Egypt. There he doubted God's protection and lied about his wife. God protected her miraculously. Abram returned enriched but separated from Lot, whose flocks had multiplied and caused strife.

stories.story_title: War, Rescue, and Priestly Blessing
stories.summary: Kings waged war and captured Lot. Abram armed his trained men and rescued his nephew. He was then blessed by Melchizedek, the priest of the Most High God, who brought bread and wine.

stories.story_title: Covenant Vision: Stars, Fire, and Prophecy
stories.summary: God appeared to Abram in a vision and promised descendants as numerous as the stars. Abram believed, and God counted it to him as righteousness. God made a covenant, prophesying that his descendants would be enslaved in Egypt for 400 years.

stories.story_title: Hagar and Ishmael: Human Plans vs. Divine Promise
stories.summary: Sarah, impatient for a son, gave her servant Hagar to Abram. Ishmael was born, but God's covenant remained with Abram. God renamed him Abraham, sealed the covenant with circumcision, and promised that Isaac—born to Sarah—would be his heir.

stories.story_title: Sodom's Mercy Boundary: Hospitality and Judgment
stories.summary: The Lord appeared to Abraham with visitors. Abraham showed them hospitality. He pleaded with God to spare Sodom if righteous people were found there. But Sodom had transgressed greatly; God rained down fire and destroyed it, yet Lot and his daughters escaped.

stories.story_title: Abimelech and Deception Reprised
stories.summary: Abraham traveled to Gerar and again told the king that Sarah was his sister. God came to Abimelech in a dream and warned him. Abimelech returned Sarah with gifts, and made a covenant with Abraham.

stories.story_title: Isaac Born: Promise Fulfilled, Ishmael Cast Out
stories.summary: Isaac was born when Abraham was 100 and Sarah was 90, fulfilling the promise. Sarah had Hagar and Ishmael cast out. God protected Ishmael in the wilderness and made him into a great nation.

stories.story_title: The Akedah: Ultimate Test of Faith
stories.summary: God tested Abraham, commanding him to offer his only son, Isaac, as a sacrifice. Abraham obeyed. As he raised the knife, God stopped him, saying he now knew Abraham's fear of God. God provided a ram instead and reaffirmed His covenant.

stories.story_title: Sarah's Death and Machpelah Purchase
stories.summary: Sarah died at 127 years old. Abraham mourned her and negotiated to purchase the cave of Machpelah as a burial place, securing the first inheritance of the promised land for his family.

stories.story_title: Isaac's Bride: Rebekah Chosen by Providence
stories.summary: Abraham sent his servant to find a bride for Isaac from among his relatives. At the well, the servant prayed for a sign. God answered: Rebekah appeared and showed kindness to the servant and his camels. She became Isaac's wife.

stories.story_title: Abraham's Legacy: Death and Ishmael
stories.summary: Abraham died at 175 years old, full of years and satisfied with his life. His covenant was transferred to Isaac alone, while Ishmael's line was established as a great nation in its own right.

stories.story_title: Twins and Birthright: Esau's Hunger
stories.summary: Isaac's wife Rebekah became pregnant with twins. God revealed that the older would serve the younger. When born, Jacob came out holding Esau's heel. Years later, Esau despised his birthright and sold it to Jacob for a bowl of stew.

stories.story_title: Isaac in Gerar: Tested Promises and Disputes
stories.summary: Isaac traveled to Gerar during a famine and repeated his father's mistake—claiming his wife was his sister. God blessed him greatly; he dug wells and made covenants. But Esau troubled him by marrying Hittite women.

stories.story_title: Jacob's Theft: Disguise and Blessing Stolen
stories.summary: Isaac, old and blind, called Esau to hunt and bring him food so he could give him the patriarchal blessing. Rebekah overheard and helped Jacob deceive his father. Jacob received the blessing meant for Esau, and fled to Haran to escape his brother's rage.

stories.story_title: Jacob's Dream: Ladder to Heaven
stories.summary: Jacob fled toward Haran and dreamed of a ladder reaching from earth to heaven, with God's angels ascending and descending. The Lord appeared and renewed the covenant promise. Jacob vowed to honor God and return a tenth of all he received.

stories.story_title: Jacob in Mesopotamia: Laboring for Family
stories.summary: Jacob served Laban fourteen years—seven for Rachel and seven more when deceived with Leah first. Through his wives, he fathered twelve sons. Jacob's cunning with breeding produced great flocks, though Laban envied his wealth.

stories.story_title: Jacob's Flight: Stolen Idols and Covenant
stories.summary: Jacob fled Laban with his wives, children, and livestock. Rachel secretly took her father's household idols. Laban pursued but couldn't find them. Jacob and Laban made a covenant at Mizpah and parted peacefully.

stories.story_title: Peniel: Wrestled by God, Named Israel
stories.summary: Jacob wrestled with a Man (God) until dawn and prevailed. God touched his hip, crippling him, then renamed him Israel ('he who wrestles with God'). Jacob saw God's face and was transformed. He was reconciled with Esau and settled in Canaan.

stories.story_title: Dinah's Defilement: Vengeance and Purification
stories.summary: Dinah was seduced by Shechem, the son of a local chief. Jacob's sons deceived the city, requiring circumcision as a marriage condition. The men were circumcised, then murdered by Simeon and Levi. Jacob returned to Bethel to purify his household and renew his covenant with God.

stories.story_title: Esau's Line: Edom Separated and Recorded
stories.summary: Esau's genealogy was recorded, showing his line that became Edom, dwelling in Mount Seir. Esau's rejected line is documented as a contrast to Jacob, through whom the covenant would continue.

stories.story_title: Joseph's Dreams: Beloved Son Betrayed
stories.summary: Joseph had dreams showing his brothers and parents bowing to him. His brothers hated him for his boasting and his father's favoritism. In jealousy, they stripped him of his coat of many colors and sold him to Midianite traders who brought him to Egypt.

stories.story_title: Judah and Tamar: Redemptive Interlude
stories.summary: Judah's first two sons died for their wickedness. Judah refused to give his youngest son Shelah to Tamar. Tamar disguised herself as a prostitute, conceived twins with Judah, and secured her place in the line leading to David and Jesus.

stories.story_title: Joseph in Egypt: Virtue Amid Temptation
stories.summary: Joseph served Potiphar and found favor, becoming overseer of his house. Potiphar's wife tempted Joseph repeatedly. He resisted and fled, but was falsely accused and imprisoned. Even in prison, God blessed him and he found favor.

stories.story_title: Pharaoh's Dreams: Joseph's Exaltation
stories.summary: Pharaoh dreamed of seven fat cows eaten by seven thin cows, and seven full ears eaten by seven withered ears. Joseph interpreted: seven years of plenty followed by seven years of famine. Pharaoh exalted Joseph to rule Egypt and prepare for the crisis.

stories.story_title: Famine's Test: Brothers Descend for Grain
stories.summary: Famine struck the land. Jacob sent his sons to Egypt to buy grain, but kept Benjamin at home. Joseph recognized his brothers but tested them, accusing them of being spies and keeping Simeon as hostage while returning their money.

stories.story_title: Benjamin's Journey: The Cup Test Deepens
stories.summary: Jacob reluctantly sent Benjamin with his other sons. Joseph welcomed them, placed his silver cup in Benjamin's sack, and accused him of theft. Judah stepped forward and offered himself as a slave instead of Benjamin, revealing his transformed heart.

stories.story_title: Reconciliation: Joseph Revealed and Egypt Received
stories.summary: Joseph revealed himself to his brothers, saying God had sent him ahead to preserve their lives. He brought his entire family—70 people—to Egypt and settled them in Goshen to survive the famine and enjoy his protection.

stories.story_title: Vayechi: Jacob's Blessing and the Promise Endures
stories.summary: Jacob blessed his twelve sons with tribal prophecies before he died. Joseph brought his sons to Jacob, who crossed his hands and blessed the younger over the older. Joseph was assured that God would bring his descendants to the promised land. Jacob died, and his body was carried back to Canaan for burial.
